toggle.heading: Here are the best colleges in the U.S.

hero.title: Best National University Rankings
hero.description: Schools in the National Universities category, such as the University of Chicago and Carnegie Mellon University, offer a full range of undergraduate majors, plus master's and doctoral programs. These colleges also are committed to producing groundbreaking research.
hero.subtitle: Here are the best colleges in the U.S.

institution.aliasNames: College of St Scholastica College of Saint Scholastica

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT may not be required by school for some or all applicants, and in reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores, or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

items.blurb: Founded in 1912, The College of St. Scholastica is a private institution. The College of St. Scholastica follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

acceptanceRate.noteText: Data reported to U.S. News in previous years

satAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

actAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

items.blurb: Founded in 1927, Edgewood College is a private institution.

satAvg.noteText: In reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

actAvg.noteText: In reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

items.blurb: Georgia State University, located in downtown Atlanta, is one of the largest universities in Georgia. To help ease the college transition, first-year students can opt into the Freshman Learning Communities program, which groups students based on shared interests.

institution.footnote: School declined to have a school official verify the accuracy of the information contained in the U.S. News Main statistical survey.

satAvg.noteText: In reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

actAvg.noteText: In reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

items.blurb: Founded in 1904, Oklahoma City University is a private institution. Oklahoma City University follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

institution.aliasNames: UNC University of North Carolina Greensboro

items.blurb: At UNC Greensboro, students can get involved in about 200 organizations and Division I sports. Notable UNCG alumni include Pulitzer Prize-winning poet Claudia Emerson and Tony Award-winning actress Beth Leavel.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1902, University of Indianapolis is a private institution.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: University of Missouri—St. Louis offers more than 120 organizations, including fraternities and sororities and and student government. UMSL students can also explore campus media opportunities by becoming a DJ or writing for the student newspaper.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1862, University of South Dakota is a public institution. The school has 51.9% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at University of South Dakota is 16:1.

Located about 85 miles south of Detroit in northern Ohio, Bowling Green State University offers nearly 300 student clubs, about 40 Greek organizations and an anonymous, masked spirit crew. Notable alumni include Academy Award-winning actress Eva Marie Saint.
Founded in 1924, Harding University is a private institution. Harding University follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered more selective.

utag_data.stitial_fact: Upward of 304,000 Chinese students studied in the U.S. during the 2014-2015 academic year.
